fraud_indicators: Policy initiated only 5 days before incident
No police report filed for a collision
Claim filed shortly after incident (5‑day delay, but still within a short window of a brand‑new policy)
Cluster of similar claims in the same geographic area (3 recent claims)
Use of a single, possibly low‑cost provider (Quick Fix Auto Body) that is frequently cited in recent claims
reasoning: John Doe’s claim exhibits several classic red flags for early‑policy fraud. The policy was purchased just five days before the reported rear‑end collision, which is unusually short for a legitimate loss. The absence of a police report or any witnesses makes it difficult to corroborate the incident description. Additionally, the claim was filed only five days after the incident, which is typical for a genuine claim, but the timing relative to the policy start raises suspicion. The local area has experienced three similar collision claims in the past few weeks, suggesting a possible pattern of opportunistic filing. The selected repair shop, Quick Fix Auto Body, has been used in multiple recent claims and may be part of a coordinated scheme. While the claim amount ($15,000) is within the range of a moderate repair, the combination of these factors elevates the fraud risk.
recommended_actions: Request a formal police report or an official incident report from the local law enforcement agency.
Obtain and review any available dash‑cam or surveillance footage from the intersection.
Conduct a detailed interview with the policyholder to verify timeline, vehicle condition, and any potential witnesses.
Arrange for an independent adjuster to inspect the vehicle and obtain a repair estimate from a second, unrelated body shop.
Check the claim history and fraud database for Quick Fix Auto Body to see if it has been flagged in prior investigations.
Place the claim on a watchlist and consider a temporary hold on payment pending verification.
If evidence supports the claim, proceed with standard processing; if inconsistencies remain, refer to the fraud investigation unit.
